Articles.Content: Landed a craft on Duna. After launching back into space it kept the "Landed" state and the map wouldnt show orbit lines for it. I changed the state manually in the craft file back to "Orbiting" and that fixed it. The lander also had a problem where when a kerbal got out it fell over.
Manouver nodes also seem to not create a predicted orbit
Had a similar issue doing a rescue mission from the Mun

This also happens to me if I launch again after I've landed. By changing the "situation" of the spacecraft in the save file, the issue was resolved and the maneuver nodes worked fine. I had started flying with the spacecraft before doing this, don't know if that makes a difference.

Save files are located in:

C:\Users\"user"\AppData\LocalLow\Intercept Games\Kerbal Space Program 2\Saves\SinglePlayer

please replace C: with whatever drive you've installed the game on and replace "user" with whatever your PC username is (PC login, not ksp2 username)

Scroll past the first thousand lines and look for   "Situation": "Landed",

change "Landed" to "Orbiting"

Hopefully this helps people fix it until the devs can sort it properly.
